item.title: It’s really hard to talk about JavaScript best practices and JMVC
item.description: I was totally enthusiastic, when I first learned about JavaScriptMVC – because it brings all the best practices you are accustomed to into the JavaScript world. That means the MVC architecture, Object-oriented development with simulated inheritance, EJS templates, easy testing, OpenAjax support, powerful event delegation and so on. However, I often have a hard time to convince other developers about those advantages. I guess testing is the easiest one, because no developer would dare to argue against testing, even though many developers don’t do it or don’t do it right.
